title: Allegheny Portage Railroad National Historic Site: Get Involved
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved           Get Involved         VIP Jim Effinger (left) and Park Ranger John Hrubochak (right) portray stonecutters for the annual "Spirits of the Summit" tour in early October. Valerie D. Chamberlin, VIP  Volunteering is the number 1 way to get more involved here at Allegheny Portage Railroad National Historic Site. Depending on your area of interest, you can put on a costume and help Park Rangers lead interpretive programs or even lead a program of your own; rove on a trail and provide information to hikers; assist in the visitor center with greeting visitors; and/or even conducting or assisting in original, ongoing research. Really, the opportunities are endless. If you are interested in volunteering, please call (814) 886-6150 and ask for the volunteer coordinator.       Current Job Opportunities Applications for jobs with the National Park Service are accepted via USAJOBS, the federal government's official source for federal job listings and employment opportunity information. The jobs listed below are drawn from USAJOBS, and clicking on any of them will take you to the detailed job announcement on USAJOBS. This list includes only jobs open to U.S. citizens. To see jobs open to eligible federal employees as well or to search for other employment opportunities, visit USAJOBS.         Current Volunteer Opportunities
